doc.field: Series XXIII: Pride and Progress / The Right Stuff
Series XXIII: Pride and Progress / The Right Stuff
[1]--Pride and Progress. Episode No. 1 [2]--The Right Stuff, Episode No. 118[Air Date: 10/4/1984]
[1]--Pride and Progress. Episode No. 1 [2]--The Right Stuff, Episode No. 118[Air Date: 10/4/1984]

Pride and ProgressNews - highlights:1. Massachusetts Congressman Gary Studds, openly gay, wins primary victory; Interview with David Bender of the Studds campaignCOMMERCIAL: "Badlands," NYC gay bar2. Sports report3. Federal government requests AIDS funding4. Rutgers University offers "Homosexuality in Society" course5. FBI files on gay organizations released6. Referendum to repeal gay rights in Maryland7. Human Rights Commission: gay and lesbian discrimination documentation project; interview with Katy TaylorCOMMERCIAL: Chamberlain and Associates, career service professionalsCOMMERCIAL: "New York Native"8. Three teens charged in death of Charles Howard, a gay man in Maine9. Interview with Vivian Shapiro, Human Rights CampaignCOMMERCIAL: "The Connect"Healthline: Conversations with GMHC: Dr. Steven Caiazza discusses "How to Reduce Risk of Getting AIDS"COMMERCIAL: World of Video
The Right Stuff:COMMERCIAL: National Fund for Human Dignity with Abigail "Dear Abby" Van BurenCOMMERCIAL: Pensione, San Francisco Hotel1. Interview with Phyllis Diller, entertainerCOMMERCIAL: H. Clay Friedrichs Realtors, New JerseyCOMMERCIAL: Rio Adventure, Orpheo travel agency2."Brothers," a Showtime cable comedy seriesCOMMERCIAL: "People in Touch," a gay dating service3. "Fever of an Unknown Origin" - Interviews with actor playwright Stephen Holt, actor Raymie Priesmeyer, scenes from the playCOMMERCIAL: World of VideoCOMMERCIAL: Spur Productions4. Phyllis Diller interview/ closing creditsCOMMERCIAL National Fund for Human Dignity with Judge Steven Lax
